section: Client agrees to pay to Company to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A.
explanation: The contract states that Exhibit A (Scope of Work) is attached to the agreement. However, there is no mention of what happens if Exhibit A is missing, incomplete, or contradictory to the main body of the agreement. This creates a loophole as to what terms prevail if there is a conflict. This is an omission of a key contractual clause.

section: Any changes to the Scope of Work following the execution of this Agreement requiring Additional Work must be submitted to and accepted by Company in writing as a "Change Order". Additional Work shall be defined as the addition or revision of pages, graphics, or other features, any text, graphic or page design or programming requiring more than two rounds of textual or graphical revisions, substantial revisions to text and/or content provided by Client, changes to elements which have been finalized, or significant changes in the Scope of Work.
explanation: The term 'Additional Work' is defined, but the financial implications of such 'Additional Work' (i.e., costs) are not clarified. There is no mention of cost per addition or revision. This is an omission of a key contractual clause.

section: Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018.
explanation: This section mentions specific start and end dates for the project which are important obligations. If calculation is done, 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 would land on May 3, 2018. The 12 weeks of project time is not clearly defined. This is an inconsistency as to how the obligations are defined.
